plugins.name: Inkblot Notes
plugins.description:
Inkblot Notes by Inkblot

Turn notes from Inkblot sessions into sticky notes in FigJam


New to Inkblot? See how you can simplify your research studies


How it works

1. Enter a session ID

2. Once submitted, all notes from the session are imported and organized by author and session time

You can import notes from multiple sessions into a single FigJam file
plugins.tagline: Turn notes from Inkblot sessions into sticky notes in FigJam

99347.name: Inkblot Notes
99347.description:
Inkblot Notes by Inkblot

Turn notes from Inkblot sessions into sticky notes in FigJam


New to Inkblot? See how you can simplify your research studies


How it works

1. Enter a session ID

2. Once submitted, all notes from the session are imported and organized by author and session time

You can import notes from multiple sessions into a single FigJam file

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin accesses the Inkblot API to fetch sticky notes.

99347.tagline: Turn notes from Inkblot sessions into sticky notes in FigJam

plugins.name: ex-portable
plugins.description:
Ex-portable is a super simple plug-in for Figma that allows you to pull export settings from a main component in a library to an instance. That’s all.


Get settings for selected instances

Select the instances you want to apply the export settings from a main component in a library for, and select this command.


Get settings for all instances

Got a lot of instances on your page? Select this command to apply export settings from their main components.
plugins.tagline: Port your export settings from component to instance.

97644.name: ex-portable
97644.description:
Ex-portable is a super simple plug-in for Figma that allows you to pull export settings from a main component in a library to an instance. That’s all.


Get settings for selected instances

Select the instances you want to apply the export settings from a main component in a library for, and select this command.


Get settings for all instances

Got a lot of instances on your page? Select this command to apply export settings from their main components.
97644.tagline: Port your export settings from component to instance.

plugins.name: Easy Select
plugins.description:
Easy Select helps you expedite the tedious and repetitive selection workflows with handy 1-click shortcuts.


-> Simply select one item, then:

  1. Select its parent / children / siblings
  2. Select others with the same color, name, size, rotation ...


-> Or, select a few items, then:

  1. Filter down to those with a particular type, name...


-> Save your carefully curated selections as bookmarks for reuse.


-> Restore from a list of historical selections.


For questions or feedback, please email easy-select@smarter.town.
plugins.tagline: The all-in-one selection helper

95109.name: Easy Select
95109.description:

plugins.name: Pitchiro
plugins.description:
Ever created a pitch deck that felt sketchy, wasn’t memorable enough, or failed to clearly communicate your project’s core value—so investors turned their backs on you?


Pitchiro lets you generate professional, unique, Y-Combinator-enhanced decks without worrying about them being too generic or inefficient.


Just select the graphics, font, and palette you like, and BOOM... your bulletproof pitch deck is ready!


Plugin features include:

  1. Pitch deck creation
  2. Pre-made deck regeneration


No AI—just flexible templates crafted by professional designers.
plugins.tagline: Pitch Deck Generator — Unique investor-ready deck templates in a minute

plugins.name: Spelling Checker
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you find English spelling mistakes inside your Figma designs quickly and effortlessly. By default, it checks all the text on the page. If you select a specific frame or text layer, it will only scan those. Smart, simple, and focused on making your designs error-free.


It’s a lightweight tool built to improve content accuracy without interrupting your workflow.


→ Detects spelling mistakes across your design

→ Works on full pages or selected layers

→ Minimal, clean, and easy to use


I love working at the intersection of design and code. If you're building creative tools, design plugins, or storytelling experiences, let’s connect.


Reach out anytime: hey@abdulwahab.design

Or connect on LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/heyabdulwahab/

accepted.name: Abdul Wahab
accepted.description:
Senior Visual Design Analyst at Accenture Song
— — — 
I blend creativity and technical background to design beautiful efficient interfaces and experiences ◡̈

plugins.tagline: Real-time spelling correction in any text field

plugins.name: Pixel Painter for Figma
plugins.description:
✨ What is Pixel Painter?

Bored in Figma? Need a quick brain break between design reviews? Pixel Painter lets you unleash your inner 8-bit artist right inside Figma — one pixel at a time. Think pixel art meets coffee break.


🎮 How It Works

  1. Fire up the plugin, get a random fun drawing challenge (like “Draw a cat in 1 minute” 😺).
  2. Use the color palette to fill a pixel grid — no judgment on your MS Paint skills.
  3. Timer keeps the pressure on — can you beat the clock?
  4. Save your masterpiece as PNG (complete with a cheeky watermark).


🧠 Why It Rocks

  1. 100+ non-repeating prompts keep the creativity flowing
  2. Click-to-color grid, color palette, and timer — like Figma meets Mario Paint
  3. Works inside the plugin popup — no canvas mess
  4. Great for solo play
plugins.tagline: Take a break and draw Pixels.

plugins.name: Private Comments – Personal Notes in Figma
plugins.description:
The first-of-its-kind plugin that lets you add private comments to any frame or layer in your file.


Whether you're jotting reminders, tracking feedback, or planning edits — Private Comments help you stay organized without cluttering your file or notifying your team.


🗂️ Attach comments to specific frames / layers

✅ Mark as done / not done

🧠 Keep thoughts to yourself — No public comments or notifications

🔍 Edit, or delete comments anytime

📦 All comments are saved in your file


Perfect for noting feedback, internal critiques, or just managing your mental checklist or ideas directly inside Figma.

accepted.name: Manas Manohar
accepted.description:
Fintech | Product Designer

I love the process of creation. The process of building something new...

plugins.tagline: Add private, personal notes to frames and layers – just for you.

plugins.name: Content Kit
plugins.description: his Figma plugin allows designers to quickly generate Nigerian-themed content directly within their projects, saving time and enhancing local relevance. The plugin includes customizable templates, authentic text content (e.g., Yoruba proverbs, Pidgin phrases, or local idioms), cultural icons, and elements inspired by Nigeria’s rich diversity. Whether designing for digital products, branding, or social media, the plugin ensures an authentic touch, fostering deeper connections with Nigerian audiences. Users can tweak settings to suit various languages, regions, and styles, making it a versatile tool for creative professionals.
plugins.tagline: Generate Nigerian names and more!

plugins.name: Side note
plugins.description:
Meet Side Note, your minimalist companion for organizing thoughts, ideas, and to-dos in style. Side Note is designed for simplicity, focus, and seamless integration with your creative workflow. Whether you're jotting down quick ideas or capturing important notes, Side Note keeps everything neat and accessible.


Key Features:


  1. Customizable Notes: Add titles, content, and importance labels to make each note unique.
  2. Smart Sizing: Flexible vertical layouts with precise padding for a polished design.
  3. Intuitive Interface: Clean, modern UI for a distraction-free note-taking experience.
  4. Important Labeling: Highlight key notes with an elegant "Important" tag for quick prioritization.
  5. Effortless Integration: Built for seamless use within Figma, perfect for designers on the go.
plugins.tagline: Quick Notes, Seamless Workflow.

plugins.name: Easily Name output
plugins.description:
Step 1: Export Name Mapping


Prefix the node name with "▼". For example: "▼page-template".

Enter the Google Sheet URL in the first input field or click the file button to select a file.

The number of nodes must match the number of rows in the uploaded document (excluding the title).

The name mapping should be in the first column, with the column header named "Name".

Specify the corresponding sheet name.

If an XLSX file is selected, the first sheet will be prefilled.

Step 2: Export


Select the nodes to be exported.

If none are selected, all nodes on the current page starting with "▼" will be exported.

Choose the export format (PDF/PNG/JPG/SVG).
plugins.tagline: Replace Export Names for Figma Frame Types

plugins.name: Zero Me
plugins.description:
Zero Me: Center Your Starting Point


Start designing from anywhere on the canvas, and when you're ready, let Zero Me center your creations. Simply select your frames and objects, run the plugin, and Zero Me will position your designs at coordinates (0, 0), keeping your canvas clean and organized.


Zero Me is a small but mighty Figma plugin that simplifies the process of centering and aligning your designs. It's for designers who want to maintain a tidy workspace and ensure a consistent starting point for their projects.


Key Features:

1. Center Alignment: Zero Me sets the position of your selected frames and objects to coordinates (0, 0), providing a centered starting point for your designs.

2. Multiple Object Support: Select multiple frames and objects, and Zero Me will align them all to the center of the canvas.


Install Zero Me and experience the convenience of a centered starting point for your Figma designs.


Created by Taryn + Claude 3 Opus
plugins.tagline: Center you Frames, Objects, Sections, and Self 🧘

plugins.name: Button Genie Pro
plugins.description:
Welcome to Button Genie Pro, the Figma plugin that instantly generates a fully featured button component set with every variant, state and Token, so you can focus on design, not tedious setup.


https://geniepro.app/


Quick Start


1. Create a new page in your Figma file where you want to place your button component set.

2. Run the plugin: Search for Button Genie Pro.

3. Follow the two-step UI to create variables and generate buttons.



Create Variables Foundations


On the first screen of the plugin, a single click generates 5 variable collections to lay the foundation of your button system. This makes updating your buttons much more flexible:

00 Primitives

01 Style Tokens

02 Semantic Colors

03 Sizing Tokens

04 Component Tokens

05 Typography



Preview and Generate Button Set


1. Light and Dark Mode: See your Primary, Secondary, and Tertiary buttons side by side in Light and Dark Mode. When you choose your Light or Dark Base Color, Button Genie Pro will automatically define the reverted color. (You can always tweaks colors later in your Figma Variables section).

2. Real-time Contrast Check always make sure your text meets WCAG AA or AAA standards.

3. Customize:

- Button text

- Stroke width for secondary button

- Horizontal/vertical padding, gap, and border radius

- Toggle variants: hover, focus, selected, disabled

- Add icon-only or pill-shaped buttons

4. Create Button Set: Click to generate up to 360 variants (3 types × 5 states × 2 shapes × 3 sizes × 4 content variants), a set of semantic buttons (Success, Warning, Error), and a set of placeholder icons. The base color you choose will be added to your custom color scale (myColor/randomName/50–900) in the Primitives variable collection.



Use Your Button Component


- All generated buttons are grouped into component sets in your document.

- Drag instances onto any frame and override text or icon as needed.

- Variables keep your design tokens flexible: update a token to cascade changes through every button.



Troubleshooting


- If you don't see new components:

  1. Ensure you've correctly generated variables/tokens at the first screen, before generating your button set.
  2. This plugin needs a Figma paid subscription to create Variable Modes. Make sure your have one. If not, the plugin will not work as expected.

- For manual hex input issues, make sure to include a leading `#` and six hex digits.
plugins.tagline: Instantly generates fully featured button component sets with variants & variables (tokens).

plugins.name: Pixel Pal: Mood Dancer
plugins.description: A cute pixel-art designer girl lives in your plugin panel. She starts off sleeping 💤, dances 💃 when you click her, and gets scared 😱 when you long-press. Bonus? plugins.name: Select Matching Layers in Frame
plugins.description:
Instantly find repeated frames or component instances within the same frame and edit them all at once.


Figma’s built-in “Select Matching Layers” feature only works across different frames. This plugin is similar but works within a single frame. Quickly select repeating elements within a single frame and adjust their properties, just like the multi-edit feature. For convenience I recommend setting up a custom shortcut for the plugin.


Pair with Master plugin

Turn matching layers into a single component in seconds with the Master plugin:

1. Use Select Matching Layers in Frame to find all repeated elements

2. Run Master → Create Component from Objects

3. Done. You’ll get a single, clean component with overrides preserved


Technical details:

  1. Select all instances of a component (including variants) when selecting an instance
  2. Select all layers with matching name and type when selecting any other layer
  3. Searches within the same frame only
  4. Select multiple objects within different frames, plugin will find all the matches


If you have any questions or feedback, please comment below!
plugins.tagline: Instantly find, select and edit similar layers within a single frame

129369.tagline: Instantly find, select and edit similar layers within a single frame

plugins.name: Fig Toolkit
plugins.description:
Fig Toolkit is your all-in-one Figma companion, focused on helping designers sort, align, and organise their workspace faster and more intuitively. With powerful sorting tools, renaming capabilities, and precise alignment options, you can bring structure and clarity to any design layout. For those managing text consistency, the toolkit also scans and identifies unstyled or mixed text layers, making it easy to apply or update text styles.


🔹 Easily sort and rename layers

🔹 Precisely align elements with adjustable spacing

🔹 Wrap layers into new sections with custom padding

🔹 Reorder layers directly in the layers panel

🔹 Detect mixed or unstyled fonts

🔹 View and fix text layers missing styles

🔹 Apply or update text styles quickly

🔹 Streamline your design workflow with ease
plugins.tagline: Sort, Align & Manage Styles in Figma Effortlessly

plugins.name: Frame Toggler
plugins.description: Problem : When presenting a solution, explaining the main workflow while showcasing multiple design options for each page can clutter the view. Solution : Use this tool to collapse alternative pages in the main workflow, displaying only the first option initially. After presenting the main flow, click a toggle button to expand all pages for detailed discussions

plugins.name: Notes
plugins.description:
Notes is a Figma plugin designed to streamline collaboration between designers, project managers, and engineers. It enhances the design handoff process by providing a structured way to document and share feedback directly within Figma. Whether you're annotating designs, adding development notes, or organizing project details, Notes ensures seamless communication and clarity across teams.

With Notes, design handoff becomes more efficient, reducing miscommunication and making it easier for teams to align on project goals.

accepted.name: TemiTope Aiyegbusi
accepted.description: designing for the next billion users.

plugins.tagline: Seamless Collaboration, Effortless Handoff

plugins.name: Stockpress
plugins.description:
About

Welcome to the Stockpress plugin for Figma, where you can quickly find and add files from your Stockpress workspace to your Figma designs. Once ready, export Frames and images back to Stockpress - complete with Frame URLs for easy access to working files!


What is Stockpress?

Stockpress is a refreshingly simple Digital Asset Management system–for everyone. One centralized workspace to add, organize, collaborate on, and share files with unlimited users and teams.


How to get started:

  1. First, sign up for a Stockpress workspace (get started for free!)
  2. Upload or import your files and folders to get organized
  3. Install the Stockpress plugin for Figma and connect your account
  4. Easily add files from Stockpress to your Figma designs
  5. Export Frames, images, and/or Frame URLs back to Stockpress


For help, contact us through your in-workspace chat or email us at help@stockpress.co
plugins.tagline: Add files from your Stockpress workspace to your design and export Figma assets back once ready

Stockpress is a refreshingly simple Digital Asset Management system–for everyone. One centralized workspace to add, organize, collaborate on, and share files with unlimited users and teams.


How to get started:

  1. First, sign up for a Stockpress workspace (get started for free!)
  2. Upload or import your files and folders to get organized
  3. Install the Stockpress plugin for Figma and connect your account
  4. Easily add files from Stockpress to your Figma designs
  5. Export Frames, images, and/or Frame URLs back to Stockpress


For help, contact us through your in-workspace chat or email us at help@stockpress.co

plugins.name: skinnerplugin
plugins.description:
Bring your CSS themes to life effortlessly with Skinner. This plugin empowers designers to create, manage, and apply consistent styles across all elements of their Figma projects with ease. By simply providing a CSS theme, Skinner instantly generates paint styles for backgrounds, text, and accents, enabling a streamlined and cohesive design workflow.


With Skinner, you can:


Generate and update styles in seconds.

Maintain a consistent design aesthetic across your projects.

Easily switch between different color themes and accents for versatile design needs.

Whether you’re designing for web, mobile, or any digital interface, Skinner ensures that your styles are always organized, professional, and ready for use.


Simplify. Style. Create. With Skinner.
plugins.tagline: Skinner - Seamless Style Generation for Figma

plugins.name: Wrighty
plugins.description:
Meet Wrighty – your go-to Figma plugin for instant, AI-powered content generation! Imagine filling all your screens with perfectly crafted text in seconds. Wrighty doesn’t just generate words; it adapts them. From landing pages to app flows, Wrighty intuitively matches your specified tone and context, creating unique, on-brand content for every screen you design.


Forget hours spent drafting and editing copy. With Wrighty, just a few clicks auto-generate clear, compelling text that resonates with your target audience. Need to rephrase content across multiple screens? No problem—Wrighty does it all, maintaining consistency and quality to let you focus on design.


Why Wrighty? It’s fast, smart, and seamless. Wrighty empowers you to scale your creative output, delivering screen-ready content that’s as polished as your visuals. Join thousands of Figma users who have already leveled up their workflow with Wrighty. Generate more, customize better, and design faster with Wrighty—the content engine that keeps up with your creativity!
plugins.tagline: AI-powered assistant for all UX writing needs.

plugins.name: RTS CopyBookCreator
plugins.description:
The plugin pulls all texts from selected frames and creates a CSV-file. The CSV will have 4 columns to help you organize your copybook. These columns are: Name of the Frame, Name of the Group, Name of the Text-Style, Text. If you organize your designs accordingly, you'll get a neatly structured Copybook.


Important: The plugin uses semicolons as delimiter, so that Excel can show the CSV properly.
plugins.tagline: Pulls all texts from your figma designs and creates a csv file.

107835.name: RTS CopyBookCreator
107835.description:

These columns are: Name of the Frame, Name of the Group, Name of the Text-Style, Text. If you organize your designs accordingly, you'll get a neatly structured Copybook.


Important: The plugin uses semicolons as delimiter, so that Excel can show the CSV properly.
107835.tagline: Pulls all texts from your figma designs and creates a csv file.

plugins.name: Components Explorer
plugins.description:
Component Explorer allows you to easily locate and manage all your components, both local and remote, and easily find all their instances.


**Key Features:**


• View all your components in one place, organized by name or grouped by page


• Quickly filter between local and remote components


• Find specific components with instant search


• Locate all instances of a component with a single click


• Navigate directly to any component or instance in your document


Thanks for your feedback!

plugins.name: Alt Text Generator
plugins.description:
Overview

Generate alt text for images using AI. Improve SEO and accessibility for your websites and rank higher on Google.


Benefits

Automatic: Alt text is automatically added to every image on the site using bulk feature.


Free Credits: Get 5 free credits upon sign up.


Extensive Image Support: Supports the following image types: JPEG, JPG, PNG, GIF, and WEBP.


SEO and Accessibility: Alt text generated is highly optimized to rank higher and improve SEO.


Features

Generate alt text using AI - Use AI to automatically generate alt text for your images.


Bulk generate - Automatically detects all images on site editor and adds alt text.


How It Works

Open plugin.


Get a free API key from https://alttextgeneratorai.com/dashboard


(5 free credits upon sign up)


Start generating alt text for free.


Done!


Credits

The plugin works based on credits. You get 5 free credits upon sign up. If you need to recharge credits, you can visit our pricing page.


Pricing

We don't like monthly plans, so all of our plans are one-time payment plans and affordable to all users.
plugins.tagline: Generate alt text for images using AI

plugins.name: Combine Pages
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin built for designers who value organization just as much as iteration.


Whether you're wrapping up a sprint, handing off files, or simply cleaning house, Archive & Combine Pages helps you bring order to your design file with ease. Select any number of pages, and this plugin will neatly group their content into a single new page titled Archive [date]. Each page’s content is preserved as a section, spaced evenly and grouped for clarity. Once processed, original pages are renamed with an ARCHIVED_ prefix — so nothing gets lost, but everything gets tidied.
plugins.tagline: Merge pages. Archive cleanly.

128785.name: Combine Pages
128785.description:
A Figma plugin built for designers who value organization just as much as iteration.


Whether you're wrapping up a sprint, handing off files, or simply cleaning house, Archive & Combine Pages helps you bring order to your design file with ease. Select any number of pages, and this plugin will neatly group their content into a single new page titled Archive [date]. Each page’s content is preserved as a section, spaced evenly and grouped for clarity. Once processed, original pages are renamed with an ARCHIVED_ prefix — so nothing gets lost, but everything gets tidied.

plugins.name: Set Gradient Style
plugins.description:
The plugin allows you to transfer the parameters of a new gradient to previously published styles, simplifying the process of manually transferring angles and breakpoints. This may be necessary if you need to update the current style, but doing it manually will cause.


  1. Select a Frame, Rectangle or Vector with a new gradient
  2. Write local style name which you want to update
  3. Press "Set style"
plugins.tagline: Transferring a gradient parameters to a previously published style

124350.name: Set Gradient Style
124350.description:
The plugin allows you to transfer the parameters of a new gradient to previously published styles, simplifying the process of manually transferring angles and breakpoints. This may be necessary if you need to update the current style, but doing it manually will cause.


  1. Select a Frame, Rectangle or Vector with a new gradient
  2. Write local style name which you want to update
  3. Press "Set style"
124350.tagline: Transferring a gradient parameters to a previously published style

  2. run plugin via the Action Menu ( ⌘+P, CTRL + P)

plugins.name: Structura Swagger Annotator
plugins.description:
Description

Structura revolutionizes how you manage API, design, and copy documentation. With an all-in-one platform, gain clarity on workflows, discover the exact APIs and components used, and ensure precise copies across your designs.


How To?

  1. Run this plugin into your figma files
  2. Paste the whole swagger documentation
  3. Select one of the component and map it by filling the correct path and method
  4. To update the swagger just reupload again the whole json swagger


Feature Request?

Feel free to request more features, for this plugin. Next roadmap for this plugin will be:

  1. Code generation for API request
  2. Hands On API Request on Plugin
  3. Copywriter integration(such as integrating with lokalise)
plugins.tagline: Simplify API and Design documentation by annotating component with swagger API docs.

  3. Copywriter integration(such as integrating with lokalise)
113888.tagline: Simplify API and Design documentation by annotating component with swagger API docs.

plugins.name: CSS Custom Property to Figma
plugins.description:
1. Register CSS Color Custom Properties

• Simply copy CSS color custom properties and paste them into the input field.

• The plugin automatically parses and registers them as styles or variables.


2. Fast and Simple Conversion Flow

• Complete the flow with ease: paste your CSS code → Apply

• No complex setup required.
plugins.tagline: Converts CSS color custom properties into styles or variables
